page.title: 05A HISTORY OF SEND SCHOOLS
page.content: Send Primary School opened in September 1854. It was built on Send sand pits which belonged to the Earl of Clandon. The school accomodated 100 children and included a school house for the teachers. Improvements were made to the building over the next 118 years. In 1939 St.Bede's C.of E. Secondary School opened in Bush Lane. In 1972 Send Primary School moved its premises from Church Lane to the Bush Lane site and re-opened as St.Bedes C.of E. Primary School with about 313 pupils. Secondary school children were taken by bus to the Guildford comprehensive school whilst the closure of Ripley Primary School brought children from Ripley, Okham, Wisley and Clandon to St. Bede's. Subsequently St Bede's became a Middle School with pupils from 8-12 years. In 1985 the school had 232 pupils.
